description.narrative: 1. Regional dialogue results in enhanced understanding by the region on collective steps that would contribute towards stability and development in Rakhine State. 2. Consultations with Bangladesh and Myanmar at multiple levels result in stronger mutual understanding and enhanced cooperation on the Rohingya issue especially on border and security issues. 3. Myanmar is exposed to relevant international experiences and humanitarian practices that contribute to more constructive policies and long-term stability in Rakhine State. 4. Official international processes including the Bali Process and the Annan Commission are effective in their contributions to addressing the Rohingya issue and are informed by the views of affected regional States.

The intervention is a Project support to Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue (HD). The Project aims at securing long term stability and promoting solutions through sustained dialogue at the regional level.
Utvecklingsinsatsen är ett projektstöd till Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue (HD) för ett regionalt dialoginitiativ som syftar till att förbättra situationen för olika grupper i regionen.

participating-org.narrative: CHD/Henry Dunant Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue
CHD/Henry Dunant Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue

description.narrative: The “Rohingya Regional Dialogue” project was supported between 1st May 2017 to 30th April 2019 (the project received a no-cost extension with the original end date being 31st December 2018). The project included various initiatives to establish both bilateral and regional dialogue to increase mutual understanding and cooperation, to in turn achieve a greater level of human security and regional stability. As a result of the deterioration of the situation in Rakhine state in August 2017, HD’s originally planned regional involvement had to be reassessed and, hence, the main priority became to achieve bilateral dialogue between Myanmar and Bangladesh. Examples of achieved results during the project period: - HD convened six informal bilateral meetings at a track 1.5 level (four meetings included government officials from both countries as observers) and through this managed to establish an informal channel of communication between Myanmar and Bangladesh. During this time, these meetings were one of the few (if not the only) high level bilateral dialogue between the two countries and as a result helped mitigate the deterioration of the bilateral relationship at an extremely critical point. - To further promote mutual understanding and to support the bilateral channel between the two countries, HD organised an exchange visit to Bangladesh with a Myanmar track 1.5 delegation consisting of retired government officials, civil society representatives and academics. - HD also managed to build a channel of dialogue between retired senior military officials (reporting back to serving military in both countries) from Myanmar and Bangladesh to discuss security concerns in relation to the current refugee crisis. - Throughout the project, HD has supported and advised respective regional governments in their efforts to mitigate the current crisis. They, for example, closely advised the Indonesian Foreign Minister on Indonesia's efforts to mitigate the Rakhine crisis which included the discreet meeting on international access in Rakhine State hosted by Indonesia in early 2019 which lead Myanmar to allow the ASEAN Coordinating Centre for Humanitarian Assistance on Disaster Management (AHA Centre) access to Northern Rakhine State. - HD set-up diaspora focus groups with Rohingya women in Bangladesh and Malaysia, gathering information about their requisitions and views on the difficult issues of safety and reintegration. The outcomes of these discussions were reported back to affected governments (Myanmar, Bangladesh, Malaysia, Thailand and Indonesia) to help shape their responses to the needs of the refugees.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
